intro: Securigera orientalis, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features delicate, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
